Text: Generator issues Cc Conway Summarizing the issue as I can understand them Your problem Cat will have to change the units at Station to to make the driver HP for kw As I indicated we need to also make adjustment so that the emissions do not exceed that of the as presented originally on March My problem The EPA will only allow the generators to emit a cumulative tonnage that works out to be running hours a year To get the hours that I need the generation at both stations I will need to reduce total emissions by about percent Obviously in the fully loaded condition were at lower horsepower is not an option Need some way to work these two items out to a mutually agreeable solution Dont know the effect on your systems ie the cat engines if a catalytic system is installed or if this is better then revision to the clean burn units which if I recall just makes the hp worse Id also like to keep the units at and similar for spare issues and other items but would need to have a good idea what this is costing before I can approve The other issue is that I need to resolve this within two days I be in Phoenix tomorrow but will leave my cell phone on Otherwise leave a message on phone mail Email will not be all that great Appreciate your help Byron

FW G Emissions Datadata Original Message From Ralph McDowell ltorfercomENRON Sent Thursday October PM To Rance Byron Subject RE G Emissions Data Byron Here is G emissions data to Ralph Original Message From mailto Sent Thursday October PM To ltorfercom Subject RE G Emissions Data Ralph Guessed wrong Can you run the low emissions case up to full power in steps of including the point Dont need the other cases Original Message From Ralph McDowell ltorfercomENRON Sent Thursday October AM To Rance Byron Subject G Emissions Data Byron Attached file contains emissions data for the G engine at Low Emission Catalytic Combustion and Standard Combustion for kW load which is forwarded to you per Dave Conways request Thank you Ralph McDowell Project Engineer Altorfer Power Systems th Street SW Cedar Rapids IA Voice x Fax email G EMISSIONS DATA kWdoc G EMISSIONS DATA kWdoc File G EMISSIONS DATA kWdoc This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you G EMISSIONS DATAdoc

Generator issues Cc Conway Summarizing the issue as I can understand them Your problem Cat will have to change the units at Station to to make the driver HP for kw As I indicated we need to also make adjustment so that the emissions do not exceed that of the as presented originally on March My problem The EPA will only allow the generators to emit a cumulative tonnage that works out to be running hours a year To get the hours that I need the generation at both stations I will need to reduce total emissions by about percent Obviously in the fully loaded condition were at lower horsepower is not an option Need some way to work these two items out to a mutually agreeable solution Dont know the effect on your systems ie the cat engines if a catalytic system is installed or if this is better then revision to the clean burn units which if I recall just makes the hp worse Id also like to keep the units at and similar for spare issues and other items but would need to have a good idea what this is costing before I can approve The other issue is that I need to resolve this within two days I be in Phoenix tomorrow but will leave my cell phone on Otherwise leave a message on phone mail Email will not be all that great Appreciate your help Byron
